csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Chaikin Oscillator
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// An oscillator based on the Accumulation/Distribution Line (ADL).
11 /// Calculated as the difference between a 3-period EMA and a 10-period EMA of the ADL.
12 /// Used to anticipate changes in the ADL.
13 /// </remarks>
14 public class ChaikinOscillator
15 {
16 public int FastPeriod { get; }
17 public int SlowPeriod { get; }
18 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
19​
20 public ChaikinOscillator(int fast = 3, int slow = 10)
21 {
22 FastPeriod = fast;
23 SlowPeriod = slow;
24 }
25​
26 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
27 {
28 Values.Clear();
29 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
30 if (c.Count == 0) return;
31​
32 // Step 1: Calculate Accumulation Distribution Line (ADL)
33 var adlValues = new List<decimal>();
34 decimal currentAdl = 0;
35​
36 foreach (var candle in c)
37 {
38 decimal range = candle.High - candle.Low;
39 decimal clv = 0;
40 if (range != 0)
41 clv = ((candle.Close - candle.Low) - (candle.High - candle.Close)) / range;
42
43 currentAdl += clv * candle.Volume;
44 adlValues.Add(currentAdl);
45 }
46​
47 // Step 2: Calculate EMAs of ADL
48 var fastEma = CalculateEma(adlValues, FastPeriod);
49 var slowEma = CalculateEma(adlValues, SlowPeriod);
50​
51 // Step 3: Difference
52 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
53 {
54 if (fastEma[i].HasValue && slowEma[i].HasValue)
55 Values.Add(fastEma[i]!.Value - slowEma[i]!.Value);
56 else
57 Values.Add(null);
58 }
59 }
60​
61 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEma(List<decimal> source, int period)
62 {
63 var results = new List<decimal?>();
64 decimal multiplier = 2.0m / (period + 1);
65 decimal? prevEma = null;
66​
67 for (int i = 0; i < source.Count; i++)
68 {
69 if (i < period - 1)
70 {
71 results.Add(null);
72 continue;
73 }
74​
75 if (prevEma == null)
76 {
77 decimal sum = 0;
78 for (int j = 0; j < period; j++) sum += source[i - j];
79 prevEma = sum / period;
80 results.Add(prevEma);
81 }
82 else
83 {
84 decimal ema = (source[i] - prevEma.Value) * multiplier + prevEma.Value;
85 results.Add(ema);
86 prevEma = ema;
87 }
88 }
89 return results;
90 }
91​
92 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int fast = 3, int slow = 10)
93 {
94 var co = new ChaikinOscillator(fast, slow);
95 co.Calculate(candles);
96 return co.Values;
97 }
98 }
99}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (ChaikinOscillator)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Chaikin Oscillator (CO).
7//
8// [Core Concepts]
9// 1. MACD applied to Accumulation/Distribution Line (ADL).
10// [Why] Monitor momentum of money flow, not price.
11// [What] Chaikin Oscillator = EMA(ADL, Fast) - EMA(ADL, Slow).
12//
13// 2. Accumulation/Distribution Line (ADL)
14// [What] Running total of Money Flow Volume.
15// [Formula] ADL[i] = ADL[i-1] + (CLV * Volume)
16//
17// 3. EMA (Exponential Moving Average)
18// [Why] Smooth the ADL to find trends.
19//
20// [Visual]
21// Data Flow:
22//
23// Candles
24// │
25// ▼
26// Calculate CLV & MFV
27// │
28// ▼
29// Calculate Cumulative ADL (Running Total)
30// │
31// ├─────────────────────────────┐
32// ▼ ▼
33// Fast EMA (3-period) Slow EMA (10-period)
34// │ │
35// └──────────────┬──────────────┘
36// ▼
37// Difference (Fast - Slow)
38// │
39// ▼
40// Chaikin Oscillator
41//
42// =============================================================================
43​
44using System;
45using System.Collections.Generic;
46​
47namespace TechnicalIndicators
48{
49 // =============================================================================
50 // CandleData
51 // =============================================================================
52 public readonly record struct CandleData(
53 DateTime Timestamp,
54 decimal Open,
55 decimal High,
56 decimal Low,
57 decimal Close,
58 long Volume
59 );
60​
61 // =============================================================================
62 // ChaikinOscillator Class
63 // =============================================================================
64 public class ChaikinOscillator
65 {
66 // Properties
67 public int FastPeriod { get; }
68 public int SlowPeriod { get; }
69 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
70​
71 // Constructor
72 public ChaikinOscillator(int fast = 3, int slow = 10)
73 {
74 FastPeriod = fast;
75 SlowPeriod = slow;
76 }
77​
78 // =============================================================================
79 // Main Calculate Method
80 // =============================================================================
81 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
82 {
83 Values.Clear();
84 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
85 if (c.Count == 0) return;
86​
87 // -------------------------------------------------------------
88 // Step 1: Calculate Accumulation/Distribution Line (ADL)
89 // [Why] This is the base data source for the EMA calculation.
90 // -------------------------------------------------------------
91 var adl = new List<decimal>();
92 decimal currentAdl = 0; // Running total accumulator
93​
94 foreach (var candle in c)
95 {
96 // Range calculation
97 decimal range = candle.High - candle.Low;
98
99 // CLV calculation (Close Location Value)
100 // Use 0 if range is 0 to avoid division by zero
101 decimal clv = range != 0
102 ? ((candle.Close - candle.Low) - (candle.High - candle.Close)) / range
103 : 0;
104
105 // MFV = CLV * Volume
106 decimal mfv = clv * candle.Volume;
107​
108 // Accumulate into ADL
109 currentAdl += mfv;
110
111 // Store in list
112 adl.Add(currentAdl);
113 }
114​
115 // -------------------------------------------------------------
116 // Step 2: Calculate EMAs of the ADL
117 // [Why] We need a Fast trend and a Slow trend of the money flow.
118 // -------------------------------------------------------------
119 var fastEma = EmaFromValues(adl, FastPeriod);
120 var slowEma = EmaFromValues(adl, SlowPeriod);
121​
122 // -------------------------------------------------------------
123 // Step 3: Compute Oscillator (Fast - Slow)
124 // [Why] The "MACD" logic: difference implies momentum.
125 // -------------------------------------------------------------
126 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
127 {
128 if (fastEma[i].HasValue && slowEma[i].HasValue)
129 {
130 Values.Add(fastEma[i]!.Value - slowEma[i]!.Value);
131 }
132 else
133 {
134 Values.Add(null);
135 }
136 }
137 }
138​
139 // =============================================================================
140 // IPO: EmaFromValues
141 // =============================================================================
142 //
143 // [Input]
144 // - source: List<decimal> (The data series to smooth, e.g., ADL)
145 // - period: int (The smoothing window)
146 //
147 // [Process]
148 // 1. Calculate Smoothing Factor k = 2 / (period + 1).
149 // 2. Loop through source data.
150 // 3. First (period-1) items: Not enough data -> null.
151 // 4. Item (period-1): Initialize with SMA (Simple Moving Average).
152 // 5. Subsequent items: Apply EMA formula:
153 // EMA = (Value - PreviousEMA) * k + PreviousEMA
154 //
155 // [Output]
156 // - List<decimal?> (The smoothed EMA series)
157 //
158 // [Visual]
159 // k = 0.33 (Period=5)
160 // Value: 10 12 11 ...
161 // EMA: NA NA 11 ... (Initialized)
162 // (11 is avg of first 5?)
163 // Next EMA = (Val - Prev) * k + Prev
164 // =============================================================================
165 private static List<decimal?> EmaFromValues(List<decimal> source, int period)
166 {
167 var results = new List<decimal?>();
168
169 // Smoothing constant
170 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
171
172 decimal? prevEma = null;
173​
174 for (int i = 0; i < source.Count; i++)
175 {
176 // Case A: Not enough data for initial SMA seed
177 if (i < period - 1)
178 {
179 results.Add(null);
180 continue;
181 }
182​
183 // Case B: Initialization step (Simple Moving Average seed)
184 if (i == period - 1)
185 {
186 decimal sum = 0;
187 for (int j = 0; j < period; j++)
188 {
189 sum += source[i - j];
190 }
191 prevEma = sum / period;
192 results.Add(prevEma);
193 continue; // Skip standard EMA calc for this step
194 }
195​
196 // Case C: Standard EMA Calculation
197 // EMA = (Price - Prev) * k + Prev
198 if (prevEma.HasValue)
199 {
200 decimal ema = (source[i] - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
201 results.Add(ema);
202 prevEma = ema; // Update state for next iteration
203 }
204 }
205 return results;
206 }
207​
208 // =============================================================================
209 // Static Wrapper
210 // =============================================================================
211 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int fast = 3, int slow = 10)
212 {
213 var co = new ChaikinOscillator(fast, slow);
214 co.Calculate(candles);
215 return co.Values;
216 }
217 }
218}
python_simple:
1class ChaikinOscillator:
2 """
3 Chaikin Oscillator
4 Difference between Fast EMA(3) and Slow EMA(10) of the ADL.
5 """
6 def __init__(self, fast=3, slow=10):
7 self.fast = fast
8 self.slow = slow
9 self.values = []
10​
11 def calculate(self, candles):
12 self.values.clear()
13 if len(candles) == 0: return
14​
15 # 1. ADL
16 adl_values = []
17 curr_adl = 0.0
18 for c in candles:
19 rng = c['high'] - c['low']
20 clv = ((c['close'] - c['low']) - (c['high'] - c['close'])) / rng if rng != 0 else 0
21 curr_adl += clv * c['volume']
22 adl_values.append(curr_adl)
23​
24 # 2. EMAs
25 fast_ema = self._ema(adl_values, self.fast)
26 slow_ema = self._ema(adl_values, self.slow)
27​
28 # 3. Diff
29 for i in range(len(candles)):
30 if fast_ema[i] is not None and slow_ema[i] is not None:
31 self.values.append(fast_ema[i] - slow_ema[i])
32 else:
33 self.values.append(None)
34​
35 def _ema(self, source, period):
36 res = []
37 k = 2 / (period + 1)
38 prev = None
39 for i in range(len(source)):
40 if i < period - 1:
41 res.append(None)
42 continue
43 if prev is None:
44 prev = sum(source[i-period+1 : i+1]) / period
45 res.append(prev)
46 else:
47 prev = (source[i] - prev) * k + prev
48 res.append(prev)
49 return res
50​
51def calculate(candles, fast=3, slow=10):
52 co = ChaikinOscillator(fast, slow)
53 co.calculate(candles)
54 return co.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (ChaikinOscillator)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Chaikin Oscillator. We explain *why* code is written this way and
7# *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. A/D Line as Base
11# First, calculate the Accumulation/Distribution Line.
12# This is the cumulative money flow measure.
13#
14# 2. MACD-Style Approach on A/D Line
15# Apply two EMAs to the A/D Line (fast and slow).
16# Chaikin Oscillator = Fast EMA(A/D) - Slow EMA(A/D)
17# Same concept as MACD but on A/D instead of price.
18#
19# 3. Momentum of Money Flow
20# Rising Chaikin Osc = A/D momentum accelerating (accumulation speeding up)
21# Falling Chaikin Osc = A/D momentum decelerating (distribution speeding up)
22#
23# [Trading Signals]
24# - Positive: Accumulation momentum
25# - Negative: Distribution momentum
26# - Zero crossover: Change in money flow direction
27#
28# =============================================================================
29​
30​
31# -------------------------------------------------------------
32# Type-Level Explanation: ChaikinOscillator (class)
33#
34# [Why] Two-stage calculation: A/D Line → EMA difference.
35# Configurable fast/slow EMA periods.
36#
37# [What] Measures momentum of the A/D Line.
38# Default periods: fast=3, slow=10.
39#
40# [Who] Money flow momentum traders, A/D divergence traders.
41#
42# [Where] Heap allocation - stores result list.
43# -------------------------------------------------------------
44class ChaikinOscillator:
45​
46 # -------------------------------------------------------------
47 # Constructor: __init__
48 #
49 # [Why] Store EMA periods. No strict validation.
50 # -------------------------------------------------------------
51 def __init__(self, fast=3, slow=10):
52 self.fast_period = fast
53 self.slow_period = slow
54 self.values = []
55​
56​
57 # =============================================================================
58 # IPO: calculate
59 # =============================================================================
60 #
61 # [Input]
62 # - candles: list[dict] - Each dict has 'high', 'low', 'close', 'volume'.
63 #
64 # [Process]
65 # 1. Calculate cumulative A/D Line
66 # 2. Calculate fast EMA of A/D
67 # 3. Calculate slow EMA of A/D
68 # 4. Chaikin Osc = Fast EMA - Slow EMA
69 #
70 # [Output]
71 # - None (results stored in self.values)
72 # =============================================================================
73 def calculate(self, candles):
74​
75 # -------------------------------------------------------------
76 # Logic Step 1: State Reset
77 # -------------------------------------------------------------
78 self.values.clear()
79​
80 # -------------------------------------------------------------
81 # Logic Step 2: Empty Input Guard
82 # -------------------------------------------------------------
83 if len(candles) == 0:
84 return
85​
86 # -------------------------------------------------------------
87 # Logic Step 3: Calculate Cumulative A/D Line
88 #
89 # [Why] (Intent)
90 # A/D Line is the foundation. Same logic as A/D Line indicator.
91 #
92 # [How] (Logic)
93 # Cumulative sum of CLV × Volume.
94 #
95 # [Visual]
96 # Bar 0: CLV=0.5, Vol=1000 -> Sum=500
97 # Bar 1: CLV=-0.2, Vol=2000 -> -400 -> Sum=100
98 # adl = [500, 100, ...]
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 adl = []
101 adl_val = 0
102​
103 for c in candles:
104 rng = c['high'] - c['low']
105​
106 # -------------------------------------------------------------
107 # Logic Step 3.1: Calculate CLV (Multi-Way Decision)
108 #
109 # [Decision]
110 # Is range zero?
111 #
112 # [True Branch: Zero]
113 # CLV = 0.
114 #
115 # [False Branch: Calculate]
116 # CLV = ((C-L) - (H-C)) / (H-L).
117 # -------------------------------------------------------------
118 if rng != 0:
119 clv = ((c['close'] - c['low']) - (c['high'] - c['close'])) / rng
120 else:
121 clv = 0
122​
123 adl_val += clv * c['volume']
124 adl.append(adl_val)
125​
126 # -------------------------------------------------------------
127 # Logic Step 4: Calculate EMAs of A/D Line
128 #
129 # [Why] (Intent)
130 # Fast EMA captures short-term A/D momentum.
131 # Slow EMA captures longer-term A/D trend.
132 # Difference shows momentum acceleration.
133 # -------------------------------------------------------------
134 fast_ema = self._ema_from_values(adl, self.fast_period)
135 slow_ema = self._ema_from_values(adl, self.slow_period)
136​
137 # -------------------------------------------------------------
138 # Logic Step 5: Calculate Chaikin Oscillator
139 #
140 # [How] (Logic)
141 # Chaikin Osc = Fast EMA(A/D) - Slow EMA(A/D)
142 #
143 # [Visual]
144 # A/D Line: [1000, 1050, 1100, 1120, 1080, 1030, ...]
145 # Fast EMA: [None, None, 1050, 1085, 1083, 1057, ...]
146 # Slow EMA: [None x 9, ..., 1065, ...]
147 #
148 # Chaikin = 1057 - 1065 = -8 (distribution accelerating)
149 # -------------------------------------------------------------
150 for i in range(len(candles)):
151​
152 # -------------------------------------------------------------
153 # Logic Step 5.1: Insufficient Data Check
154 #
155 # [Decision]
156 # Do both EMAs exist?
157 #
158 # [True Branch: Calculate]
159 # Difference.
160 #
161 # [False Branch: Skip]
162 # Append None.
163 # -------------------------------------------------------------
164 if fast_ema[i] is not None and slow_ema[i] is not None:
165 self.values.append(fast_ema[i] - slow_ema[i])
166 else:
167 self.values.append(None)
168​
169​
170 # =============================================================================
171 # IPO: _ema_from_values (Private Helper)
172 # =============================================================================
173 #
174 # [Input]
175 # - s: list[float] - Source values (A/D Line)
176 # - p: int - EMA period
177 #
178 # [Process]
179 # - Standard EMA calculation with SMA seed.
180 #
181 # [Output]
182 # - list[float|None] - EMA values
183 # =============================================================================
184 def _ema_from_values(self, s, p):
185 r = []
186 k = 2.0 / (p + 1) # EMA multiplier
187 prev = None
188​
189 # -------------------------------------------------------------
190 # Logic Step 1: Main EMA Loop
191 #
192 # [Visual]
193 # period = 3
194 # In: [100, 110, 120, 110, ...]
195 # i=0,1: None
196 # i=2: SMA(100,110,120) = 110 (First EMA)
197 # i=3: (110 - 110)*k + 110 = 110
198 # -------------------------------------------------------------
199 for i in range(len(s)):
200​
201 # -------------------------------------------------------------
202 # Logic Step 1.1: Insufficient History Phase
203 # -------------------------------------------------------------
204 if i < p - 1:
205 r.append(None)
206 continue
207​
208 # -------------------------------------------------------------
209 # Logic Step 1.2: First EMA (SMA seed)
210 # -------------------------------------------------------------
211 if i == p - 1:
212 total = sum(s[i - j] for j in range(p))
213 prev = total / p
214 r.append(prev)
215 continue
216​
217 # -------------------------------------------------------------
218 # Logic Step 1.3: Recursive EMA Calculation
219 #
220 # [How] (Logic)
221 # EMA = (Price - Prev) * k + Prev
222 # -------------------------------------------------------------
223 e = (s[i] - prev) * k + prev
224 r.append(e)
225 prev = e
226​
227 return r
228​
229​
230# =============================================================================
231# Static Wrapper Function: calculate
232# =============================================================================
233#
234# [Why]
235# Provides functional API for one-shot calculations.
236#
237# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
238# =============================================================================
239def calculate(candles, fast=3, slow=10):
240 # 1. Instantiation
241 # [Why: Setup state]
242 co = ChaikinOscillator(fast, slow)
243​
244 # 2. Execution
245 # [Why: Process data]
246 co.calculate(candles)
247​
248 # 3. Extraction
249 # [Why: Return clean result]
250 return co.values
